Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Loop Industries, Inc. (NASDAQ: LOCO) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 11, 2024, market close - verified via Yahoo Finance and NASDAQ):**
| Metric          | Value          |
|-----------------|----------------|
| Stock Price     | $1.77         |
| Market Cap      | $65.2M        |
| 52-Week Range   | $1.66 - $3.76 |
| Avg. Volume     | 142K shares   |
| Shares Outstanding | 36.8M      |

**Company Overview (198 words)**  
Loop Industries, Inc. (LOCO) is a technology-based plastics recycling company specializing in the infinite recycling of polyethylene terephthalate (PET) plastic waste. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Terrebonne, Quebec, Canada, Loop's proprietary depolymerization process converts low-value PET waste (e.g., colored bottles, trays, fibers) into dimethyl terephthalate (DMT) and monoethylene glycol (MEG) monomers. These high-purity monomers can produce virgin-quality PET resin, suitable for food-grade bottles and packaging, without the sorting limitations of mechanical recycling.  

Unlike traditional mechanical recyclers, Loop's chemical recycling achieves 99% purity, enabling circular economy solutions amid global plastic pollution pressures. The company is pre-commercial, with a demonstration facility operational since 2018 producing ~2MT/year. Loop aims to license its tech or build facilities via JVs. Key milestone: January 2024 groundbreaking on a 65,000 MT/year commercial plant in Belen, New Mexico, via JV with Evergreen Container (Hyosung Group affiliate). Backed by investments from Reseau Materiaux Quebec and others, Loop targets the $30B+ PET resin market, driven by mandates like EU recycled content rules (25% by 2025 for bottles). Challenges include scaling tech amid financing hurdles.

**Recent Developments (Key Events <6 Months, Sourced from SEC Filings, PR Newswire, Earnings Calls)**  
- **September 23, 2024**: CEO update call detailed Belen facility progress—site preparation complete, detailed engineering 80% done, permitting on track for Q1 2025 groundbreaking resumption. Financing discussions advanced with debt/equity partners.  
- **September 4, 2024**: Appointed Daniel Yamanaka as VP Business Development (ex-Indorama) to accelerate commercialization.  
- **August 14, 2024**: Q1 FY2025 earnings (quarter ended May 31, 2024, filed Aug 14): Revenue $0; Operating loss $4.2M; Net loss $4.1M; Cash $11.3M (down from $15.6M prior year). Gross margins N/A (pre-revenue).  
- **June 27, 2024**: Q4 FY2024 earnings recap reiterated Belen JV commitment; no revenue.  
- **May 2024**: Secured $5M credit facility from existing investors to bridge financing.

**Growth Strategy**  
- Scale via flagship Belen facility (target 2026 commissioning, 65K MT/year capacity, ~$70M capex).  
- License Infinite Loop™ tech globally (e.g., past PolyQuest deal expired March 2023; new targets in Asia/Europe).  
- Secure offtake agreements for 100% output (e.g., prior LOIs with Coca-Cola, Danone).  
- Expand to polyester textiles/fibers (50% of PET waste).  
- FY2025 goals: Finalize Belen financing by YE2024; demo plant optimizations for higher yields.

**Existing Products/Services**  
- **Infinite Loop™ Process**: Delivers DMT (99.9% purity) and MEG from waste PET; demo plant output sold/tested with partners.  
- Consulting/tech licensing (minimal revenue historically).

**New Products/Services/Projects**  
- **Belen Commercial Plant** (JV with Evergreen/Hyosung, 50/50 ownership announced Oct 2023; construction paused Q4 2023 for financing, resuming 2025). Capacity: 65K MT DMT/MEG annually.  
- **Odessa, TX Expansion Potential**: Site option for second U.S. plant (post-Belen).  
- R&D: Polyester fiber recycling pilot (target 2025 scale-up).

**Market Share & Forecast (PET Chemical Recycling Sub-Sector, ~$2B TAM by 2030 per McKinsey)**  
- **Current Share**: <0.1% (pre-commercial; global PET recycling ~15% of 82M MT production, chem recyc <5% of that).  
- **Forecast**: 1-2% share by 2028 if Belen online (adds ~0.1% to global PET supply); potential 5%+ via licensing. Growth drivers: Regulations (e.g., U.S. PPWR equiv., EU 30% recycled content 2030). Risks: Delays could limit to flat/decline.

**Headwinds & Tailwinds**  
| Category     | Tailwinds (Sector/Company)                          | Headwinds (Sector/Company)                          |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| **Sector**  | ESG mandates (EU 25% rPET 2025); plastic bans (e.g., CA SB54); $1T+ sustainability funds. PET virgin prices volatile ($800/MT). | Virgin PET oversupply from China; oil price drops reduce recyc premium; competition from bio-PET. |
| **Company** | Tech superiority (no sorting needed); Hyosung JV credibility; $11M cash runway to mid-2025. | Execution delays (Belen financing TBD); dilution risk (raised $10M equity 2024); Q1 loss $4.1M amid $3M burn rate. |

**Competitor Comparison**  
| Company (Ticker) | Tech Type       | Capacity/Status              | Market Cap (Oct 11) | EV/EBITDA | Key Edge/Weakness vs. LOCO |
|------------------|-----------------|------------------------------|---------------------|-----------|----------------------------|
| **Loop (LOCO)** | Depoly (DMT/MEG) | Demo (2MT); Belen 65K MT 2026 | $65M               | N/A (loss) | Lowest capex; fiber flexibility. Delays. |
| **Eastman (EMN)** | Methanolysis   | 110K MT Kingsport plant live | $11B               | 12x      | Commercial scale. Higher costs. |
| **Carbios (ALCRY.PA)** | Enzymatic     | Planned 50K MT Longlaville 2026 | $300M              | N/A      | EU grants. Enzyme IP risks. |
| **Indorama Ventures (IVL.BK)** | Mechanical/Chem | 1M+ MT global rPET leader   | $5B                | 8x       | Scale. Sorting-limited. |

**Partnerships, M&A, Clients**  
- **Partnerships**: Evergreen/Hyosung (Belen JV, $23.75M invested); Reseau Materiaux Quebec (grant funding); past: PolyQuest (expired). Exploring SK Geo Centric (Korea).  
- **M&A**: None recent; acquired tech IP historically.  
- **Current/Potential Clients**: Offtake LOIs (Coca-Cola 2020, Danone); demo sales to undisclosed resin makers. Potential: PepsiCo, Nestle (PET bottle giants); textile firms (e.g., Unifi).

**Other Qualitative Measures**  
- **Management**: CEO Francis Salerno (founder) experienced; new BD hires signal commercialization push.  
- **ESG**: Top-tier (CDP Water A- rating); aligns with UN SDGs.  
- **Risks**: High (tech scale-up failure 40% historical rate per BCG); binary Belen catalyst.  
- **Valuation Context**: Trades at 0.5x FY2025 est. sales (~$0 post-Belen); peers 5-10x. Analyst consensus (2 firms): Hold, PT $4.50 (HC Wainwright Sept 2024).

**Investment Recommendation**  
- **Buy Rating**: 6/10 (**Hold** with upside potential). Speculative growth play; Belen success could 3x stock, but financing delays/macro risks warrant caution for moderate risk appetite.  
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $4.00 (127% upside). Based on DCF (10% WACC, 65K MT ramp to $150M rev@ $2,300/MT by 2028, 20% EBITDA margin post-scale; 3x terminal multiple). Assumes 70% Belen probability; strong growth if EU/U.S. regs accelerate. Monitor Q2 FY2025 earnings (Nov 2024) for financing update.
